title: How to Make Your Own Coffee Single Bags

steps.title: Pour 1 1/2 tbsp coffee into the round bottom area.
steps.content: Pour 1 1/2 tbsp coffee into the round bottom area. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Do this like a taco.
steps.content: Do this like a taco. All the round edges should meet. Be careful to keep the coffee within the half-moon region that represents the circular bottom.

steps.title: Both corners should come up over the front.
steps.content: Both corners should come up over the front. Bring the right to the left as far as it will allow, then fold the bottom left corner up over the front and to the right as far as it will allow. The remaining edges of the coffee filter should stick up out of the center slightly flanged wide.

steps.title: Bring it to the left.
steps.content: Bring it to the left. At the same time, bring the top left edge down and to the right so they bring the top of the filter to meet in the center. At this point the top of the filter may be slightly pointed.

steps.title: Fold the top of the filter down once about 1/4".
steps.content: Fold the top of the filter down once about 1/4". The end result should be a flat edge instead of a pointed edge.

steps.title: Fold the entire top down like an envelope flap.
steps.content: Fold the entire top down like an envelope flap. This will create a bag shape.

steps.title: If desired, a string can be stapled to the satchel at the same time.
steps.content: If desired, a string can be stapled to the satchel at the same time. [2] X Research source
